daisyui-tagline:
The most popular, free and open-source
Tailwind CSS component library
feat-5: Pure CSS. Works on all frameworks
clean-html-content: Your HTML doesn't need to be messy. daisyUI adds component classes to Tailwind CSS. Classes like btn, card, etc... No need to deal with hundreds of utility classes.
clean-html-example-1-desc: using only utility classes vs using daisyUI component classes
clean-html-example-2-desc: using only utility classes vs using daisyUI component classes
clean-html-example-3-desc: using only utility classes vs using daisyUI component classes
customizable-content:
daisyUI is based on Tailwind's utility classes and all components have low specificity so you can customize everything using utility classes.
You can even use @apply to add your custom styles to components or you can change colors and other design decisions using CSS variables.
theming-content:
daisyUI adds a set of semantic color names to Tailwind. So instead of using generic color names like bg-blue-500, we can use semantic role names like bg-primary or bg-success.
All colors are CSS variables so you easily add dark mode by changing a few CSS variables.
install-desc: No dependencies, pure CSS. Can be used as a Tailwind CSS plugin or as an independent CSS library
install-step-1: Install daisyUI as a Node package
install-step-2: Add daisyUI to Tailwind CSS as a plugin
footer-tagline:
Free Component library
For utility first CSS frameworks
